response.answer_text: When I think of a traditional business — I think of skyscrapers, offices, and things of that such. So for me, a modern business would be a business capitalising the efficiencies of the technologies created. The internet has opened up soo many channels of potential partnerships. Companies are spreading out across the world, easily. It’s now common to see Internet Startups to launch in one country, have satellite locations in others, and still be less than a couple years old. As a modern business, you need to use everything that is at your disposal to help your business. It’s like that old riddle—How can you connect all nine dots of this square with just 4 lines?  And the answer, is you need to think outside the box. Forget the Boundaries that previous businesses have laid down as “the right way to do it”. Take for example CallBackBox I’m based in the US, but I am currently in Spain. The original developer we used was in Ukraine. And I am currently using developers in Poland. My graphic design work is being done in Belarusia through a freelancer there. I had someone developed the website from the designs in India. CallBackBox is already being used in 4 Countries — US, Canada, United Kingdom, and Australia. Did I mention that we are only 8 weeks old? We’re utilizing the power of the internet to launch quickly, find great people to work with, and to spread our brand.

Complete Modern Business Definition What is a Modern Business? A modern business is that which use the latest in technology on their benefit, to maintain a competitive advantage over their competitors. They are committed deeply to delivering individual, social and environmental value, that is tightly aligning with the creation of economic value for its stakeholders.
